reviewText: Well i must admit that i bought this game as my daughter reccomended it as she had played it on her friends tablet and said to me ITS A GOOD GAME DAD"
date: OH i thought i dont know but i will get it for you and have a look at some point.\nSo she downloaded it played it and then went to bed
recommended: then i had a quick go just to check it out.\nAnd then it happened to me again i just fell in love with the simplicity of the gameplay and then found myself wanting to feed the little critter all the candy on the level.\nAnd that sums up what you have to do
hoursPlayed: but not how you have to do it "CUT THE ROPE" its that simple.\nOr is it well no some levels have you thinking and eventually you will come up with the answer but not after some head scratching has taken place to solve said levels.Each level plays out like a puzzle and there is allways an answer
voteText: and even with the hard levels the answer is usually staring you straight in the face.And thats what makes this game easy to reccommend
helpfulPercent: its easy to get into (whatever your age) and its such a simple idea that of course this game had to exist and would eventually be made by someone and then draw us in with its addictive gameplay.So if that sounds good to you buy it and if not buy something else."

reviewText: I really love this game and I rarely leave a negative review, but I'm just frustrated.\nI don't mind buying it to play on my laptop. I only paid $2, but no updates, no achievements, literally no effort put into doing anything other than a bare bones port is just pathetic. If ever they come back to this and put some effort or new levels in, I'll change my review.

reviewText:
Don't be fooled by Om Nom's cuteness; there're some clever physics puzzles and timing-based challenges with these boxes.  I almost had to ask for help a few times.  Almost.

I really wish they'd sync their ports, though.  The number of levels included in the Steam, iPad and Chrome ports are all over the place.  And this game is just begging for a level editor + Steam Workshop.

Still, a fantastic game, especially for $5.  9/10
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Cut the Rope is a fun game that can be easily used as a time waster or to play if you're bored. However, if you're a completionist (like me) this game can become rage enducing. The puzzles become more complicated as you progress through the game. And although I question it's logic at some points, it's still very fun and would recommend to anyone that's a fan of simple puzzle games like this.

reviewerDisplayName: I want to slip in the shower
reviewText:
[DID NOT FINISH]

I have played hours of this game on the iPad, they are the exact same games but the PC port is just less fun to play due to the hardware. The game is colourful, well designed, fun to play, a tad challenging and perfect for pick up and play, this however doesn't translate well to the PC market.

9/15 Get it on iPad.""
